intro: Pisonia floribunda, commonly known as the tropical hibiscus or red hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central and South America. It is a shrub or small tree that can grow up to 6 meters tall, featuring opposite, lance-shaped leaves with a rough texture. The plant produces showy, fragrant flowers in shades of red, pink, and white, which bloom in clusters at the ends of branches. Its flowers are typically five-petaled and have a prominent central stigma, typical of the Malvaceae family. The plant is also known for its ability to thrive in coastal areas and is often used in ornamental gardening.
